availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
State of New York
City & County of New York ss.

Lewis Hurst, being duly sworn says that he will well and faith execute and perform all the duties of his Station as Commissioner to take the acknowledgment of Deeds &c in the State of New York, to be and or recorded in the State of Kentucky.
Sworn to before me this 27th day of September 1862

Jas Ward Smyth.
Notary Public
N. Y. City

New York
Comr of Deeds
Oath
Lewis Hurst
Filed Octo 1. 1862
